so first I'm going to

so after a couple of

And to make that filling,

a blender attachment

Now, this part takes some time

But with some patience and with some time,

This needs to cook down

and the water should be coming

And if you've had Asian desserts before,

So now I'm spreading the paste evenly

A little trick I like

Finally, onto the mochi.

So this is shiratamako, a
certain type of glutinous

rice flour that is often
used to make mochi.

There are other types
of flour called mochiko,

but I decided to use this
one, because it creates

a softer, more elastic
texture, which I like.

After combining it with
some sugar and some water,

this gets mixed together
and cooked in the microwave
for 30-second to one minute intervals.

Now, the precise number of
times we'll have to do this

but the goal is to basically not have
any liquid remaining after stirring.
